verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.
verses.ct: Balaam told Balak, "Construct 7 altars for me here, and get 7 bulls and 7 rams ready for me."

verses.kjv: And Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.ct: Balak did what Balaam asked, and the two of them sacrificed a bull and a ram on each altar.

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Stand by thy burnt offering, and I will go: peradventure the LORD will come to meet me: and whatsoever he sheweth me I will tell thee. And he went to an high place.
verses.ct: Then Balaam told Balak, "Stay here beside your burnt offering while I go. Maybe the LORD will come to meet me, and whatever he reveals to me, I'll report back to you." Then he went off to a barren hilltop.

verses.kjv: And God met Balaam: and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered upon every altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.ct: God met with Balaam, and Balaam said to him, "I've set up 7 altars, and I've sacrificed a bull and a ram on each one."

verses.kjv: And the LORD put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, Return unto Balak, and thus thou shalt speak.
verses.ct: The LORD gave Balaam a message to speak and said, "Go back to Balak and deliver this message."

verses.kjv: And he returned unto him, and, lo, he stood by his burnt sacrifice, he, and all the princes of Moab.
verses.ct: So he went back to Balak, and there he was, standing beside his burnt offering along with all the leaders of Moab.

verses.kjv: And he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east, saying, Come, curse me Jacob, and come, defy Israel.
verses.ct: Then Balaam delivered his prophetic message: "Balak, king of Moab, summoned me from Aram, from the eastern mountains, saying, 'Come and curse Jacob for me! Come and denounce Israel!'

verses.kjv: How shall I curse, whom God hath not cursed? or how shall I defy, whom the LORD hath not defied?
verses.ct: But how can I curse someone God hasn't cursed? How can I denounce someone the LORD hasn't denounced?

verses.kjv: For from the top of the rocks I see him, and from the hills I behold him: lo, the people shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations.
verses.ct: From the rocky peaks I can see them, and from the hills I observe them. Here is a people who live apart, not counting themselves among the other nations.

verses.kjv: Who can count the dust of Jacob, and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his!
verses.ct: Who could possibly count the descendants of Jacob — as numerous as dust? Who could number even a quarter of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my end be like theirs!"

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.
verses.ct: Balak said to Balaam, "What have you done to me? I brought you here to curse my enemies, and instead you've completely blessed them!"

verses.kjv: And he answered and said, Must I not take heed to speak that which the LORD hath put in my mouth?
verses.ct: Balaam replied, "Don't I have to speak exactly what the LORD puts in my mouth?"

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from whence thou mayest see them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: and curse me them from thence.
verses.ct: Then Balak said to him, "Please come with me to a different spot where you can see them. You'll only see the outer edge of their camp, not all of them. Curse them for me from there."

verses.kjv: And he brought him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.ct: So he took him to the field of Zophim, on top of Pisgah. There he built 7 altars and sacrificed a bull and a ram on each one.

verses.kjv: And he said unto Balak, Stand here by thy burnt offering, while I meet the LORD yonder.
verses.ct: Balaam told Balak, "Wait here beside your burnt offering while I go meet with the LORD over there."

verses.kjv: And the LORD met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, Go again unto Balak, and say thus.
verses.ct: The LORD met with Balaam and gave him a message to speak, saying, "Go back to Balak and say this."

verses.kjv: And when he came to him, behold, he stood by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath the LORD spoken?
verses.ct: When he returned, there was Balak standing beside his burnt offering with the leaders of Moab. Balak asked him, "What did the LORD say?"

verses.kjv: And he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:
verses.ct: Then Balaam delivered his prophetic message: "Stand up, Balak, and listen! Pay attention to me, son of Zippor!

verses.kjv: God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?
verses.ct: God is not a human being who would lie, nor a mortal who would change his mind. Has he ever spoken and not followed through? Has he ever made a promise and not fulfilled it?

verses.kjv: Behold, I have received commandment to bless: and he hath blessed; and I cannot reverse it.
verses.ct: I was given the command to bless, and he has blessed — I have no power to reverse it.

verses.kjv: He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel: the LORD his God is with him, and the shout of a king is among them.
verses.ct: He has not observed wrongdoing in Jacob, and he has not seen wickedness in Israel. The LORD their God is with them, and the triumphant shout of a king rings out among them.

verses.kjv: God brought them out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn.
verses.ct: God brought them out of Egypt; he has the strength of a wild ox.

verses.kjv: Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob, neither is there any divination against Israel: according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath God wrought!
verses.ct: No sorcery can work against Jacob, and no divination can prevail against Israel. At the right time it will be said about Jacob and Israel, 'Look what God has accomplished!'

verses.kjv: Behold, the people shall rise up as a great lion, and lift up himself as a young lion: he shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drink the blood of the slain.
verses.ct: This people rises up like a mighty lion, lifting itself like a young lion — it won't rest until it devours its prey and drinks the blood of the fallen."

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.
verses.ct: Then Balak told Balaam, "If you won't curse them, then at least don't bless them either!"

verses.kjv: But Balaam answered and said unto Balak, Told not I thee, saying, All that the LORD speaketh, that I must do?
verses.ct: But Balaam answered Balak, "Didn't I already tell you that I must do whatever the LORD says?"

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.
verses.ct: Balak said to Balaam, "Please, come with me. I'll take you to yet another location. Maybe it will be acceptable to God for you to curse them for me from there."

verses.kjv: And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.
verses.ct: So Balak took Balaam to the summit of Peor, which overlooks Jeshimon.

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.
verses.ct: Balaam told Balak, "Build 7 altars for me here, and get 7 bulls and 7 rams ready for me."

verses.kjv: And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.ct: Balak did what Balaam asked and sacrificed a bull and a ram on each altar.
